definition.paragraph: “next”: (str) url_to_next_page_of_courses, “previous”: (str) url_to_previous_page_of_courses, “count”: (int) total_number_of_courses, “num_pages”: (int) total_number_of_pages, “current_page”: (int) current_page_number, “start”: (int) index_of_first_course_on_page, “results” : [

desc_content.paragraph: Response Error Codes: - 403: The requester cannot access resource.
Return a response given serialized page data with show_preferences flag.
Get the list of items for this view. This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset. Defaults to using self.queryset.
This method should always be used rather than accessing self.queryset directly, as self.queryset gets evaluated only once, and those results are cached for all subsequent requests.
You may want to override this if you need to provide different querysets depending on the incoming request.
(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)
Returns the list of active course enrollments for which ENABLE_NOTIFICATIONS Waffle flag is enabled

definition.paragraph: “id”: (int) notification_id, “app_name”: (str) app_name, “notification_type”: (str) notification_type, “content”: (str) content, “content_context”: (dict) content_context, “content_url”: (str) content_url, “last_read”: (datetime) last_read, “last_seen”: (datetime) last_seen

alias of NotificationSerializer
Bases: APIView
API view for marking user notifications as read, either all notifications or a single notification
Marks all notifications or single notification read for the given app name or notification id for the authenticated user.
Requests: PATCH /api/notifications/read/

Returns: - 200: OK status code if the notification or notifications were successfully marked read. - 400: Bad Request status code if the app name is invalid. - 403: Forbidden status code if the user is not authenticated. - 404: Not Found status code if the notification was not found.
Bases: APIView
Supports retrieving and patching the UserNotificationPreference model.

definition.paragraph: request (Request): The request object. course_key_string (int): The ID of the course to retrieve notification preference.

desc_content.paragraph: Update an existing user notification preference with the data in the request body.

list_item.paragraph: course_key_string (int) – The ID of the course of the notification preference to be updated.

field_body.paragraph: The updated preference, serialized using the UserNotificationPreferenceSerializer 404: If the preference does not exist 403: If the user does not have permission to update the preference 400: Validation error

desc_content.paragraph: View to update user preferences from encrypted username and patch. username and patch must be string
